Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Your Child Care Institution license is renewed. It is valid only at your present address
and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed
on 06/01/22. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation Sustainability
and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing
rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. As indicated above substantial
compliance has been established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)204-6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
- Discussion regarding the Amended Rules for Child Caring Institution effective May
31, 2022. Technical assistance was provided on how to update internal restraint
policies.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
- Within the Transitional Living Center program it was recommended when a youth
is discharged from the program to make sure the Residential Closing Report/
Case Transfer Summary goes into the youth’s physical file. The two closed cases
reviewed in the program the facility had to find the discharge summary within
another database.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period. Special Investigation number 2022C0103011 dated 04/29/22 found
the facility in noncompliance for Rule 400.4112 (4), Staff Qualifications and Rule
400.4126, Sufficiency of Staff. A corrective action plan dated 05/17/22 was approved
that included the staff member involved termination of employment, training for staff,
and creation of new internal policy. During most recent quarterly unannounced visit at
the facility on 06/01/22, the agency had made progress on have been working on
implementing each action step within their correction action plan.
The facility had two special investigations during this period under review with two
resulting in corrective actions plans. The non-compliances included staff
qualifications, sufficiency of staff, staff training and staff completing a restraint prior to
being trained. The facility’s corrective action plan compliance is monitored quarterly
and the agency has been found to be complying with the CAP.
The MDHHS Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) compliance monitoring report that
was completed on 04/15/2022 was reviewed. The following items were found in non-
compliance:
- 115.313- Supervision and Monitoring. Bethany Christian Services, Inc. did not
complete a review of their staffing plan in 2021 and document it within the MDHHS
5817 Staffing Plan Review
- 115.315- Limits to Cross- Gender Viewing and Searches. All staff are required to
knock and announce themselves when entering a room or a bathroom. All youth
interviewed by the PREA analyst denied any staff making an announcement when
entering their unit.
Bethany Christian Services’ Residential has worked with PREA to update polices to
make sure they are in compliance with PREA standards.
The facility was toured during the inspection and was very clean and in good
condition. There were no safety concerns noted during the inspection. The medication
carts were all double locked, fire extinguishers have been serviced within the last
year, fire drill logs were viewed and up to date, menus were visible for youth and staff,
and all units were orderly.
Chief Administrator Report:
Chief Administrator noted the biggest impact the facility has struggled with has been
the systematic pattern of youth continuing to remain in the residential program for (2-
6) months after they have reached maximum benefit or demonstrated significant
safety concerns, e.g. frequent AWOL and assaultive behavior. Chief Administrator
notes this places youth and staff at significant risk. Due to these concerns the
program has seen more staff turnover. The program continues to focus on
recruitment, retention, and training of staff. Chief Administrator reports the facility
continues to have team meetings throughout the year. During these meetings, staff
review policies and procedures, receive specialized training on different topics related
5

to working with youth, make enhancements to programing, and ensure high quality
service provisions at all levels.
Interviews:
Staff and youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or
concerns were raised. The youth all reported feeling safe and had positive
relationships with staff members. The staff all reported feeling supported by direct
supervisors as well as administration.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
